review_title: Low pay, no bonus, hostile environment
pros: Flexible work pressure, You can learn the operating of few instruments.
cons: Working in a job that offers low pay, no bonus, and a hostile environment can be incredibly challenging. The frustration of not being paid fairly can lead to financial strain, while the absence of bonuses can make it difficult to feel motivated to perform well. Additionally, a hostile work environment can take a toll on an employee's mental health, making it difficult to focus and feel comfortable in the workplace. Overall, these factors can create a challenging and demoralizing work experience.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator 1 in Detroit, MI
pros: Great office and culture and great place to learn or get into the field
cons: Low paying for a job that eventually requires a certification. Very little room to move up.

pros: Very close knit work setting, very kind staff and management. Relatively easy to communicate with colleagues. Nurses are very good and genuinely care about this patient population. Good work/life balance. Autonomy without overbearing oversight.
cons: EMR is outdated but useable. Lack of benefits. Difficult insurance (McLaren Health Advantage) to work with living around Detroit. No maternity leave benefits (use short term disability). Need to use PTO days to take off holidays. Pay under average for area. Limited CME money. Note*, most of these grievances are a reflection of being a part of McLaren Health System, not Karmanos specifically.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Detroit, MI
pros: The work you are doing is incredible. It’s easy to feel like you are making a difference in this field because of how involved karmanos is in the clinical trials industry. You learn something new every single day and you’ll never be bored. Once you have experience from here, you’ll be able to get a job anywhere else because Karmanos is a well-respected institution by people looking from the outside- this is the only reason I give Career Opportunities 4/5 stars- because even if you can’t develop your career much here, you’ll definitely be able to at your next job.
cons: HR is terrible. They seem to make it their goal to get rid of employees- they aren’t supportive, they’ll fight you with a force of pettiness for every bit of benefits you may get (which is not many). Senior management isn’t much better. They try to improve things, but they fail so hard at it that it doesn’t even matter. There is a LOT of high-school-like drama and it’s hard to succeed when you have childish people in management who are stuck in their ways. They say they want to focus on professional development for their employees, but then ignore suggestions for it (not purposefully, they’re just too busy and tasks aren’t delegated properly). People who should be fired for incompetence get promoted into high management positions. Mediocrity seems to be rewarded and high-achievers are stamped out. The pay is laughable- and everyone leaves because we simply don’t get paid enough to put up with their sh*t.

review_title: Overall Good Place to Start Career
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Detroit, MI
pros: Great people doing great work, and working for passionate doctors.
cons: Very clear we run as a non-profit, very hard to move around into something different.

pros: Great place to learn about oncology
cons: Short staffed low pay. very very difficult

pros: coworkers are friendly, amazing patients to work with

job_title: Ambulance Care Assistant in Detroit, MI
pros: Patients was always great and put a smile on your face
cons: Management was horrible, poor communication

pros: I really love my job and it's the best workplace environment that I've ever been in. Management really works hard to ensure employee satisfaction. Sometimes we/they get it right, and sometimes we/they don't. But the effort is there. Staff are more than just warm bodies at computers. People really care and show it. There is room for advancement and the leadership classes offered to supervisory and management positions are extremely beneficial.
cons:
Health insurance and paid time off. The worse. What kind of health care company doesn't offer separate paid holidays and sick days? 26 days to cover vacation, holidays, and sick time. Really unbelievable, but that's McLaren's faulty, not KCI's. Staff are more likely to show up sick and pass it around because they don't want to deplete their PTO. Plus, we always have to ensure we have enough time in our banks to cover upcoming holidays. And we can't even choose to take it unpaid because HR won't approve unpaid time off.
We are limited to McLaren Health Advantage for insurance, which isn't the greatest. A doctor might be covered, but not the lab they use so it makes either costly or inconvenient.

review_title: Management is bad from top to bottom
pros: (CTO)Time off is the only pro.
cons: This company is horrible to work for. Upper management knows they have a problem. Instead of fixing issues they fire the people who bring it to their attention.Human Resources consists of only one person and that person does nothing about complaints that have been going on for years.The company doesn't allow people to advance.Whatever job you are hired in is where you stay forever unless you get fired.The company barely runs because they lack training because of the high turn over rate.Plus lower level staff is more educated than the higher level staff.The higher staff are uneducated bullies.While the higher educated people are kept in low level positions and not allowed to advance.Even outsiders told this company that their were problems with the way staff is treated.The company does nothing but try to fire whistleblowers.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Detroit, MI
pros: Benefits, good amount of paid time off
cons: Poor management, no trust in its employees, always being reprimanded for being a young employee, no recognition for what you do for the team on the daily basis, poor salary pay for how much work and projects taken on.

pros: The research being done by joint staff between Wayne State School of Medicine and Karmanos Cancer institute is truly groundbreaking.   I worked on a team that created custom synthetic human DNA plasmids that showed clinical results in treating HER2 type breast cancer.  The work was truly rewarding for me as a Chemical Engineering Student, and the compensation was fair for my position.  I learned countless new lab techniques that will no doubt help me propel my career forward.  The schedules were truly open, I could come in at almost any time to complete my work, and have nearly complete autonomy in a very high tech biotech lab.
cons: No significant challenges were present.  I never had problems with any staff member, training was thorough and continuous.

review_title: Good experience that helped me discover the political influence on cancer treatments.
pros: Many educational opportunities. Provided employee appreciation days with massages, ice cream, and snacks often. Very diverse staff. Allows nurses to work with very educated specialists including pharmacists.
cons: Poor organization of chemotherapy orders and processes. Many loop holes for errors. Cockroaches were also a problem due to being in the building with the DMC. McClaren takeover changes the working environment for the worst. Doesnt have that great of medical benefits. Managers leave early all the time without consequences or notifying their staff.

pros:

cons:

High turn over rate Medical records department has had three directors in one year

Human resources has no power over management so even if you file complaints it doesn't matter

pros:
Interesting patient population
Teaching institution
good health insurance and time off
cons:
little to no CME funding
mean-spirited management
depressing, crowded office space and clinic environment
Abuse of NPs and PAs-they do 80% of the work for the doctors, but barely get any support staff.  Midlevels are strictly there to be handservants of the MD and not for the patient.  Also, doctors will throw the midlevel under the bus to cover up their own mistakes
Very stressful-most employees are obese or look very sickly.  I believe they are slowly dying from the stress

review_title: Nice place to work but with caveats
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Detroit, MI
pros: Karmanos is a wonderful research and treatment facility with an excellent reputation.
cons: Salaries in some areas of Karmanos are lower than industry average. Beginning grade levels and salaries for positions are not consistent based on experience for new hires. Older work areas in many parts of the building and connected buildings make for less than desirable work environment

pros: Co workers truly work together to give the very best in patient care.
cons:
Benefits and pay when I started in 2008 were some of the best in the Metro Detroit area. Excellent 9% match contribution to our retirement fund. After Dr. John C. Ruckdeschel left in 2009, working conditions declined. No raises for over 4 years. Contributions to retirement dropped down to 6, to 3 and finally 1 % match up to I think 1500 before I left. Many jobs were eliminated and Hospice was done away with altogether since once patients are no longer considered curable-Karmanos does not receive enough research grants to make it worth it to keep hospice. Truly upper management is so focused on chasing the research dollar I believe they have lost site of the fact that treating the patient should be continuous up to and including hospice and end of life care. It is very cold and callous when there is no further treatment useful to say to a patient we can no longer care for you and are referring you out for end of life care. Granted this is a nursing point of view. I was very disheartened and discouraged to see them disband their hospice department-when there was no financial reason to do so-it was completely in the black and not a financial loss. (other than not receiving research $ for end stage patients. 

 The nursing and physician staff are the best of the best. I highly recommend them as a nurse and a former patient.

review_title: Underpaid employees in an underperforming city
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Detroit, MI
pros: Good vacation-Start out with 4 weeks and pretty much unlimited short term disability (sick). That is pretty much it!
cons: No salary raise in 6 yrs, first raise in 2012 (2%). Poor management style. High turnovers (atleast in my department). No room for professional growth. I know employees who are at the same position for over 25 yrs (that is crazy!!!)

pros: It is a great environment for learning.

pros: I loved what I did in my role but some of the management was impossible to work with.

It's up to you to determine if everything is in network. A doctor may be in network but the lab they use is not. So you wind up being stuck with the bill!
